[{"type": "dataset", "id": "ca.cioos_b63374a9-2288-4512-9820-5d1b44d2b502", "author": [{"given": "Luba", "family": "Reshitnyk"}, {"given": "Lynn C.", "family": "Lee"}], "issued": [{"date-parts": ["2023", "09", "14"]}], "abstract": "Ce paquet de données contient des rapports et des ensembles de données relatifs à la cartographie de l'étendue spatiale de la zostère zostère (Zostera marina) sur les sites de surveillance de la réserve de parc national de Gwaii Haanas, de la réserve d'aire marine nationale de conservation et du site du patrimoine haïda, situés à Haida Gwaii, en Colombie-Britannique, au Canada. Ce travail est le fruit d'une collaboration entre l'Institut Hakai et Parcs Canada Gwaii Haanas. 

Les sites de surveillance ont été cartographiés à l'aide de petits systèmes aériens pilotés à distance (RPAS) pendant les marées basses estivales en 2016, 2017 et 2018. Les orthomosaïques ont été créés avec le logiciel Pix4Dmapper (version 2.1.61, Pix4D) sous Windows 10 et géoréférencés à l'aide de points de contrôle de groupe collectés simultanément lors des enquêtes. L'étendue de la zostère marine sur chaque site a été délimitée à l'aide d'une analyse d'images basée sur les objets (OBIA) à l'aide du logiciel eCognition Developer (eCognition Developer 9, 2014) et d'une délimitation manuelle (si nécessaire). Des données vidéo sous-marines remorquées géoréférencées (SplashCam Pro) ont été collectées sur les sites de surveillance des zostères à marée haute afin de fournir des données fiables pour l'analyse aérienne et la délimitation de la zostère. 

Le package de données inclut :
- Les rapports (.pdf) qui décrivent le projet, les méthodes de collecte et de traitement des données ainsi que les résultats des enquêtes de 2016, 2017 et 2018. 
- Des fichiers polygonaux (.shp) indiquant l'étendue de la zostère marine (Z. marina) sur chaque site de surveillance, par année.
- Fichiers de formes ponctuelles (.shp) de transects vidéo sous-marins remorqués classés classés par année. 
Système de coordonnées utilisé : NAD1983 UTM Zone 9N

Ce jeu de données fait partie du programme de cartographie de l'habitat de l'Institut Hakai et du programme de surveillance de la durabilité écologique des aires marines nationales de conservation de Parcs Canada. L'objectif global du programme de Parcs Canada est de suivre l'évolution des écosystèmes marins, de répondre aux menaces environnementales et d'assurer une utilisation écologiquement durable des ressources marines.

L'utilisation de cet ensemble de données nécessite l'autorisation de Gwaii Haanas Parcs Canada et de l'Institut Hakai. 

Veuillez communiquer et/ou collaborer avec Hakai et Gwaii Haanas Parcs Canada si vous envisagez d'utiliser cet ensemble de données pour des manuscrits ou d'autres formes de rapports.", "edition-date": "", "publisher": "Hakai Institute", "title": "Étendue spatiale des prairies de zostère marine (Zostera marina) depuis les sites de surveillance de Gwaii Haanas (2016, 2017, 2018) cartographiée à l'aide de systèmes aériens téléguidés (RPAS)", "version": "1.0", "DOI": "10.21966/gv88-hv41", "language": "fr", "URL": "https://catalogue.hakai.org/dataset/ca-cioos_b63374a9-2288-4512-9820-5d1b44d2b502?local=fr"}]
citation.en:
[{"type": "dataset", "id": "ca.cioos_b63374a9-2288-4512-9820-5d1b44d2b502", "author": [{"given": "Luba", "family": "Reshitnyk"}, {"given": "Lynn C.", "family": "Lee"}], "issued": [{"date-parts": ["2023", "09", "14"]}], "abstract": "This data package contains reports and datasets pertaining to mapping the spatial extent of eelgrass (Zostera marina) at monitoring sites within Gwaii Haanas National Park Reserve, National Marine Conservation Area Reserve, and Haida Heritage Site, located in Haida Gwaii, British Columbia, Canada. This work was a collaborative project between the Hakai Institute and Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada.  

Monitoring sites were mapped using small Remotely Piloted Aerial Systems (RPAS) (DJI Phantom Pro 3, Pro 4) during summer low tides in 2016, 2017 and 2018. Orthomosaics were created using a Structure from Motion Multi-View Stereo (SfM-MVS) workflow within Pix4Dmapper software (Version 2.1.61, Pix4D) in Windows 10 and georeferenced using group control points collected concurrently during the surveys. The extent of eelgrass at each site was delineated using object-based image analysis (OBIA) with eCognition Developer software (eCognition Developer 9, 2014) and manual delineation (where necessary). Georeferenced towed underwater video (SplashCam Pro) data were collected at eelgrass monitoring sites during high tide to provide ground-truth data for the aerial analysis and delineation of eelgrass. 

The data package includes:

- The reports (.pdf) which describe project, data collection and processing methods and results for 2016,  2017 and 2018 surveys. 
- Polygon shapefiles (.shp) of the extent of eelgrass (Z. marina) at each monitoring site by year.
- Point shapefiles (.shp) of classified towed underwater video transects by year. 

Coordinate system used: NAD1983 UTM Zone 9N

These data were collected as an ongoing partnership between Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada and the Hakai Institute. This data package is a component of the Hakai Institute’s Habitat Mapping program. The overarching objective of the Hakai Habitat Mapping program is to generate spatial inventories of coastal habitats, investigate how these habitats are changing through time, and the drivers of that change. This data package is also a component of the National Marine Conservation Area ecological sustainability monitoring program of Parks Canada. The overarching goal of the program is to track changes in marine ecosystems, respond to environmental threats, and ensure ecologically sustainable use of marine resources.

The use of this dataset requires permission from both Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada and the Hakai Institute. 

Please communicate and/or collaborate with Hakai and Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada if you are considering using this dataset for manuscripts or other forms of reporting.
Contact luba@hakai.org or data@hakai.org for more information about data access and opportunities to collaborate with the Hakai Institute. 
Contact lynn.lee@pc.gc.ca or jake.burton@pc.gc.ca for more information about data access to and opportunities to collaborate with Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada.", "edition-date": "", "publisher": "Hakai Institute", "title": "Spatial extent of eelgrass (Zostera marina) meadows from monitoring sites within Gwaii Haanas (2016, 2017, 2018) mapped using remote piloted aerial systems", "version": "1.0", "DOI": "10.21966/gv88-hv41", "language": "en", "URL": "https://catalogue.hakai.org/dataset/ca-cioos_b63374a9-2288-4512-9820-5d1b44d2b502?local=en"}]

      <mri:abstract xsi:type="lan:PT_FreeText_PropertyType">
        <gco:CharacterString>This data package contains reports and datasets pertaining to mapping the spatial extent of eelgrass (Zostera marina) at monitoring sites within Gwaii Haanas National Park Reserve, National Marine Conservation Area Reserve, and Haida Heritage Site, located in Haida Gwaii, British Columbia, Canada. This work was a collaborative project between the Hakai Institute and Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada.  

Monitoring sites were mapped using small Remotely Piloted Aerial Systems (RPAS) (DJI Phantom Pro 3, Pro 4) during summer low tides in 2016, 2017 and 2018. Orthomosaics were created using a Structure from Motion Multi-View Stereo (SfM-MVS) workflow within Pix4Dmapper software (Version 2.1.61, Pix4D) in Windows 10 and georeferenced using group control points collected concurrently during the surveys. The extent of eelgrass at each site was delineated using object-based image analysis (OBIA) with eCognition Developer software (eCognition Developer 9, 2014) and manual delineation (where necessary). Georeferenced towed underwater video (SplashCam Pro) data were collected at eelgrass monitoring sites during high tide to provide ground-truth data for the aerial analysis and delineation of eelgrass. 

The data package includes:

- The reports (.pdf) which describe project, data collection and processing methods and results for 2016,  2017 and 2018 surveys. 
- Polygon shapefiles (.shp) of the extent of eelgrass (Z. marina) at each monitoring site by year.
- Point shapefiles (.shp) of classified towed underwater video transects by year. 

Coordinate system used: NAD1983 UTM Zone 9N

These data were collected as an ongoing partnership between Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada and the Hakai Institute. This data package is a component of the Hakai Institutes Habitat Mapping program. The overarching objective of the Hakai Habitat Mapping program is to generate spatial inventories of coastal habitats, investigate how these habitats are changing through time, and the drivers of that change. This data package is also a component of the National Marine Conservation Area ecological sustainability monitoring program of Parks Canada. The overarching goal of the program is to track changes in marine ecosystems, respond to environmental threats, and ensure ecologically sustainable use of marine resources.

The use of this dataset requires permission from both Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada and the Hakai Institute. 

Please communicate and/or collaborate with Hakai and Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada if you are considering using this dataset for manuscripts or other forms of reporting.
Contact luba@hakai.org or data@hakai.org for more information about data access and opportunities to collaborate with the Hakai Institute. 
Contact lynn.lee@pc.gc.ca or jake.burton@pc.gc.ca for more information about data access to and opportunities to collaborate with Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada.</gco:CharacterString>
        <lan:PT_FreeText>
          <lan:textGroup>
            <lan:LocalisedCharacterString locale="#fr">Ce paquet de donnes contient des rapports et des ensembles de donnes relatifs  la cartographie de l'tendue spatiale de la zostre zostre (Zostera marina) sur les sites de surveillance de la rserve de parc national de Gwaii Haanas, de la rserve d'aire marine nationale de conservation et du site du patrimoine hada, situs  Haida Gwaii, en Colombie-Britannique, au Canada. Ce travail est le fruit d'une collaboration entre l'Institut Hakai et Parcs Canada Gwaii Haanas. 

Les sites de surveillance ont t cartographis  l'aide de petits systmes ariens pilots  distance (RPAS) pendant les mares basses estivales en 2016, 2017 et 2018. Les orthomosaques ont t crs avec le logiciel Pix4Dmapper (version 2.1.61, Pix4D) sous Windows 10 et gorfrencs  l'aide de points de contrle de groupe collects simultanment lors des enqutes. L'tendue de la zostre marine sur chaque site a t dlimite  l'aide d'une analyse d'images base sur les objets (OBIA)  l'aide du logiciel eCognition Developer (eCognition Developer 9, 2014) et d'une dlimitation manuelle (si ncessaire). Des donnes vido sous-marines remorques gorfrences (SplashCam Pro) ont t collectes sur les sites de surveillance des zostres  mare haute afin de fournir des donnes fiables pour l'analyse arienne et la dlimitation de la zostre. 

Le package de donnes inclut:
- Les rapports (.pdf) qui dcrivent le projet, les mthodes de collecte et de traitement des donnes ainsi que les rsultats des enqutes de 2016, 2017 et 2018. 
- Des fichiers polygonaux (.shp) indiquant l'tendue de la zostre marine (Z. marina) sur chaque site de surveillance, par anne.
- Fichiers de formes ponctuelles (.shp) de transects vido sous-marins remorqus classs classs par anne. 
Systme de coordonnes utilis: NAD1983 UTM Zone 9N

Ce jeu de donnes fait partie du programme de cartographie de l'habitat de l'Institut Hakai et du programme de surveillance de la durabilit cologique des aires marines nationales de conservation de Parcs Canada. L'objectif global du programme de Parcs Canada est de suivre l'volution des cosystmes marins, de rpondre aux menaces environnementales et d'assurer une utilisation cologiquement durable des ressources marines.

L'utilisation de cet ensemble de donnes ncessite l'autorisation de Gwaii Haanas Parcs Canada et de l'Institut Hakai. 

Veuillez communiquer et/ou collaborer avec Hakai et Gwaii Haanas Parcs Canada si vous envisagez d'utiliser cet ensemble de donnes pour des manuscrits ou d'autres formes de rapports.</lan:LocalisedCharacterString>
          </lan:textGroup>
        </lan:PT_FreeText>
      </mri:abstract>

name: ca-cioos_b63374a9-2288-4512-9820-5d1b44d2b502
notes:
This data package contains reports and datasets pertaining to mapping the spatial extent of eelgrass (Zostera marina) at monitoring sites within Gwaii Haanas National Park Reserve, National Marine Conservation Area Reserve, and Haida Heritage Site, located in Haida Gwaii, British Columbia, Canada. This work was a collaborative project between the Hakai Institute and Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada.  

Monitoring sites were mapped using small Remotely Piloted Aerial Systems (RPAS) (DJI Phantom Pro 3, Pro 4) during summer low tides in 2016, 2017 and 2018. Orthomosaics were created using a Structure from Motion Multi-View Stereo (SfM-MVS) workflow within Pix4Dmapper software (Version 2.1.61, Pix4D) in Windows 10 and georeferenced using group control points collected concurrently during the surveys. The extent of eelgrass at each site was delineated using object-based image analysis (OBIA) with eCognition Developer software (eCognition Developer 9, 2014) and manual delineation (where necessary). Georeferenced towed underwater video (SplashCam Pro) data were collected at eelgrass monitoring sites during high tide to provide ground-truth data for the aerial analysis and delineation of eelgrass. 

The data package includes:

- The reports (.pdf) which describe project, data collection and processing methods and results for 2016,  2017 and 2018 surveys. 
- Polygon shapefiles (.shp) of the extent of eelgrass (Z. marina) at each monitoring site by year.
- Point shapefiles (.shp) of classified towed underwater video transects by year. 

Coordinate system used: NAD1983 UTM Zone 9N

These data were collected as an ongoing partnership between Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada and the Hakai Institute. This data package is a component of the Hakai Institutes Habitat Mapping program. The overarching objective of the Hakai Habitat Mapping program is to generate spatial inventories of coastal habitats, investigate how these habitats are changing through time, and the drivers of that change. This data package is also a component of the National Marine Conservation Area ecological sustainability monitoring program of Parks Canada. The overarching goal of the program is to track changes in marine ecosystems, respond to environmental threats, and ensure ecologically sustainable use of marine resources.

The use of this dataset requires permission from both Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada and the Hakai Institute. 

Please communicate and/or collaborate with Hakai and Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada if you are considering using this dataset for manuscripts or other forms of reporting.
Contact luba@hakai.org or data@hakai.org for more information about data access and opportunities to collaborate with the Hakai Institute. 
Contact lynn.lee@pc.gc.ca or jake.burton@pc.gc.ca for more information about data access to and opportunities to collaborate with Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada.

notes_translated.en:
This data package contains reports and datasets pertaining to mapping the spatial extent of eelgrass (Zostera marina) at monitoring sites within Gwaii Haanas National Park Reserve, National Marine Conservation Area Reserve, and Haida Heritage Site, located in Haida Gwaii, British Columbia, Canada. This work was a collaborative project between the Hakai Institute and Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada.  

Monitoring sites were mapped using small Remotely Piloted Aerial Systems (RPAS) (DJI Phantom Pro 3, Pro 4) during summer low tides in 2016, 2017 and 2018. Orthomosaics were created using a Structure from Motion Multi-View Stereo (SfM-MVS) workflow within Pix4Dmapper software (Version 2.1.61, Pix4D) in Windows 10 and georeferenced using group control points collected concurrently during the surveys. The extent of eelgrass at each site was delineated using object-based image analysis (OBIA) with eCognition Developer software (eCognition Developer 9, 2014) and manual delineation (where necessary). Georeferenced towed underwater video (SplashCam Pro) data were collected at eelgrass monitoring sites during high tide to provide ground-truth data for the aerial analysis and delineation of eelgrass. 

The data package includes:

- The reports (.pdf) which describe project, data collection and processing methods and results for 2016,  2017 and 2018 surveys. 
- Polygon shapefiles (.shp) of the extent of eelgrass (Z. marina) at each monitoring site by year.
- Point shapefiles (.shp) of classified towed underwater video transects by year. 

Coordinate system used: NAD1983 UTM Zone 9N

These data were collected as an ongoing partnership between Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada and the Hakai Institute. This data package is a component of the Hakai Institutes Habitat Mapping program. The overarching objective of the Hakai Habitat Mapping program is to generate spatial inventories of coastal habitats, investigate how these habitats are changing through time, and the drivers of that change. This data package is also a component of the National Marine Conservation Area ecological sustainability monitoring program of Parks Canada. The overarching goal of the program is to track changes in marine ecosystems, respond to environmental threats, and ensure ecologically sustainable use of marine resources.

The use of this dataset requires permission from both Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada and the Hakai Institute. 

Please communicate and/or collaborate with Hakai and Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada if you are considering using this dataset for manuscripts or other forms of reporting.
Contact luba@hakai.org or data@hakai.org for more information about data access and opportunities to collaborate with the Hakai Institute. 
Contact lynn.lee@pc.gc.ca or jake.burton@pc.gc.ca for more information about data access to and opportunities to collaborate with Gwaii Haanas Parks Canada.
notes_translated.fr:
Ce paquet de donnes contient des rapports et des ensembles de donnes relatifs  la cartographie de l'tendue spatiale de la zostre zostre (Zostera marina) sur les sites de surveillance de la rserve de parc national de Gwaii Haanas, de la rserve d'aire marine nationale de conservation et du site du patrimoine hada, situs  Haida Gwaii, en Colombie-Britannique, au Canada. Ce travail est le fruit d'une collaboration entre l'Institut Hakai et Parcs Canada Gwaii Haanas. 

Les sites de surveillance ont t cartographis  l'aide de petits systmes ariens pilots  distance (RPAS) pendant les mares basses estivales en 2016, 2017 et 2018. Les orthomosaques ont t crs avec le logiciel Pix4Dmapper (version 2.1.61, Pix4D) sous Windows 10 et gorfrencs  l'aide de points de contrle de groupe collects simultanment lors des enqutes. L'tendue de la zostre marine sur chaque site a t dlimite  l'aide d'une analyse d'images base sur les objets (OBIA)  l'aide du logiciel eCognition Developer (eCognition Developer 9, 2014) et d'une dlimitation manuelle (si ncessaire). Des donnes vido sous-marines remorques gorfrences (SplashCam Pro) ont t collectes sur les sites de surveillance des zostres  mare haute afin de fournir des donnes fiables pour l'analyse arienne et la dlimitation de la zostre. 

Le package de donnes inclut:
- Les rapports (.pdf) qui dcrivent le projet, les mthodes de collecte et de traitement des donnes ainsi que les rsultats des enqutes de 2016, 2017 et 2018. 
- Des fichiers polygonaux (.shp) indiquant l'tendue de la zostre marine (Z. marina) sur chaque site de surveillance, par anne.
- Fichiers de formes ponctuelles (.shp) de transects vido sous-marins remorqus classs classs par anne. 
Systme de coordonnes utilis: NAD1983 UTM Zone 9N

Ce jeu de donnes fait partie du programme de cartographie de l'habitat de l'Institut Hakai et du programme de surveillance de la durabilit cologique des aires marines nationales de conservation de Parcs Canada. L'objectif global du programme de Parcs Canada est de suivre l'volution des cosystmes marins, de rpondre aux menaces environnementales et d'assurer une utilisation cologiquement durable des ressources marines.

L'utilisation de cet ensemble de donnes ncessite l'autorisation de Gwaii Haanas Parcs Canada et de l'Institut Hakai. 

Veuillez communiquer et/ou collaborer avec Hakai et Gwaii Haanas Parcs Canada si vous envisagez d'utiliser cet ensemble de donnes pour des manuscrits ou d'autres formes de rapports.
